text: My thoughts drip slow like honey—sweet, but too heavy to swallow. I am grateful, yet tired of carrying myself.
I laughed with the rain today—it fell hard and wild and I felt alive beneath it.
A quiet ache hums in my spine. Nothing is wrong, but something isn't right. I sit with it anyway.
My heart claws like an animal against tomorrow, restless and afraid.
The stars were kind tonight—they reminded me to breathe. A small miracle.
